The Discord bot was successfully created.

There are 2 ways to configure the Discord bot:

1. Configuration Wizard
The configuration wizard guides you comfortably through the configuration. This is mainly aimed at inexperienced admins who don't know exactly where to find which information for setting up the Discord bot.

2. Manual Configuration
The manual configuration is mainly intended for experienced admins who know exactly where to find which information for setting up the Discord bot.

It is recommended to use the configuration wizard.

In this step you will learn how to create a bot and where to find the bot token that you need to enter in the form below. If you have already created a bot, you can jump directly to point 3.

1. Create Application
Go the Developer Portal from Discord. Click the "New Application" button in the upper right corner. Enter a name for your application, accept the developer terms of use and click the "Create" button. Your application has now been created. Next, you need to add a bot.

2. Add bot
Go the Developer Portal from Discord. Select your previously created application. Click on the menu item "Bot" in the left menu. No bot should be visible here yet. Click on the "Add Bot" button. Now you will be asked if you really want to do it, confirm with "Yes, do it!". Your bot was successfully created.

3. Privileged Gateway Intents aktivieren
Go the Developer Portal from Discord. Select your previously created application. Click on the menu item "Bot" in the left menu. Scroll to the subheading „Privileged Gateway Intents“ and activate the sliders for the required intents (see below). Click on „Save Changes“.

4. Find Bot Token
Go the Developer Portal from Discord. Select your previously created application. Click on the menu item "Bot" in the left menu. Click on the button "Reset Token". Now you will be asked if you really want to do it, confirm with "Yes, do it!". If you have enabled two-factor authentication on Discord, you will now need to enter your code and press "Submit". You will now see your token. With a click on the button "Copy", you can paste the token directly into the clipboard.

Next, you need to invite your created Discord bot to your server. Click on the button below to do so. A new tab will open in your browser. In the opened window select your server and click the "Next" button and then the "Authorize" button. In the end, you just have to solve a captcha and the bot is already on your server.

In order for the Discord bot to work without any problems, some manual rework has to be done. Go to your Discord server in the "Server settings" and then to the item "Roles". At the end of the roles, there should now exist a role named the same as the Discord Bot. Drag this roll all the way up if possible. This gives the Discord Bot the permission to assign all roles.

Your bot should now be on your server and have all the necessary permissions. In the list below, please select which server you want to use with this bot.

A maximum of 200 servers are displayed in this list. If your bot is on more than 200 servers, please perform manual configuration of the bot.

In this step you configure the information for OAuth2. This information is needed, for example, to link a user account in WoltLab Suite with a Discord account.

Where can I find the Client Secret?
Go the Developer Portal from Discord. Select your previously created application. Click on the menu item "OAuth2" in the left menu. Click on the "Reset Secret" button. Now you will be asked if you really want to do it, confirm with "Yes, do it!". If you have enabled two-factor authentication on Discord, you will now need to enter your code and press "Submit". You will now see your client Secret. With a click on the button "Copy", you can paste the Client Secret directly into the clipboard.

In this step you configure the information for Application Commands. If you don't use a plugin that uses Discord's application commands, you can skip this step.

Where can I find the public key?
Go the Developer Portal from Discord. Select your previously created application. Click on the menu item "General Information" in the left menu. Here you will also find the public key. With a click on the button "Copy", you can paste the public key directly into the clipboard. Also, for "Interactions Endpoint Url" add the URL {link controller='DiscordInteraction' forceFrontend=true application='wcf'}{/link}.
Your Discord bot has been successfully created and configured.
Congratulations, you are now done with the configuration wizard and ready to use your Discord Bot.
